DataElement.preferredName: Plasma Preparation Tube Cryovial Aliquot Extracellular Vesicle Plasma Collection Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The collected number of cryovial aliquots of plasma that resulted from Plasma Preparation Tube (PPT) processing.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Plasma Preparation Tube Cryovial Aliquot Extracellular Vesicle Plasma Collection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An evacuated blood collection tube that contains an inert gel and spray-dried K2EDTA anticoagulant, intended for the collection of whole blood and the separation of plasma._A vial used to store specimens in a cryopreservative at very low temperatures._Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight._Bilayer membrane fragments present in the blood plasma that are released by different cell types upon activation or death. Extracellular vesicles are usually classified as either exosomes (formed by the membranes of intracellular compartments, 50?100 nm in diameter) and ectosomes (also called microparticles or microvesicles, formed from plasma membrane, 100?1000 nm in diameter)._Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An evacuated blood collection tube that contains an inert gel and spray-dried K2EDTA anticoagulant, intended for the collection of whole blood and the separation of plasma.

Concepts.definition: An evacuated blood collection tube that contains an inert gel and spray-dried K2EDTA anticoagulant, intended for the collection of whole blood and the separation of plasma.

Property.preferredName: Cryovial Aliquot Extracellular Vesicle Plasma Collection
Property.preferredDefinition: A vial used to store specimens in a cryopreservative at very low temperatures.:Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.:Bilayer membrane fragments present in the blood plasma that are released by different cell types upon activation or death. Extracellular vesicles are usually classified as either exosomes (formed by the membranes of intracellular compartments, 50–100 nm in diameter) and ectosomes (also called microparticles or microvesicles, formed from plasma membrane, 100–1000 nm in diameter).:Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Concepts.definition: A vial used to store specimens in a cryopreservative at very low temperatures.
Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

Bilayer membrane fragments present in the blood plasma that are released by different cell types upon activation or death. Extracellular vesicles are usually classified as either exosomes (formed by the membranes of intracellular compartments, 50-100 nm in diameter) and ectosomes (also called microparticles or microvesicles, formed from plasma membrane, 100-1000 nm in diameter).

Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.
